channel.title: [PI]Command Player Rights[PI]
channel.description: How do I add player rights to commands? Anytime I try to add it it gets errors. Anybody have correct way?

item.title: [PI]Command Player Rights[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]The Commands class parses the commands in different sections.

Such as:

if(c.playerRights >= 0) {
     /* Normal Commands go here */
}

if(c.playerRights >= 1) {
     /* Moderator + Commands go here */
}

if(c.playerRights >= 2) {
      /* Admin + Commands go here */
}

if(c.playerRights >= 3) {
     /* Co-owner + Commands go here */
}

if(c.donator == 1) {
     /* Donator Commands go here */
}

if(c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("OWNER_NAME") {
     /* Owner only commands go here */
}

Though, if you wish to append certain commands to different player rights, without using the different sections (mentioned above) use:

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("COMMAND_NAME") && c.playerRights >= 0) { /* The command itself */ } [/quote]
Wow Vain, you’ve helped me once more. I would rep again, but it won’t let me :'o

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Command Player Rights[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

usman555:

Show the errors, are the “cannot find symbol”?

Illegal start of expression
Not a statement
‘;’ expected (that’s easy)

btw here’s the code:

[code] if (playerCommand.startsWith(“item”)) && playerRights == 3){
try {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
c.sendMessage(“That item ID does not exist.”);
}
} else {
c.sendMessage(“Wrong usage: (Ex:(::item_ID_Amount)(::item 995 1))”);
}
} catch(Exception e) {

			}
		}
		[/code]

Read full topic
